definition: (of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

sentences.english: Water freezes at zero degrees centigrade.
A fire could be lit under the vat in winter to stop the water from freezing.
sentences.chinese: 在大缸下面是可以點火的爲了防止水冬天結冰。

sentences.english: You'll never be too careful as you drive on a ice-covered road.
sentences.chinese: 在結冰的路面上駕車時，怎麼小心都不爲過。

sentences.english: When water freezes, it becomes larger in volume instead of smaller.
sentences.chinese: 水結冰後，體積變大而非變小。
道路結冰時要緩慢地剎車。

sentences.english: The ice-free Huangpu River is the main waterway in the Shanghai area.
sentences.chinese: 常年不結冰的黃浦江是上海主要的水路通道。

sentences.english: The boy asked if water freezes at 0℃.
Large parts of the Han river that bisects the capital are frozen over.
sentences.chinese: 將首爾從中隔斷的漢江出現大面積結冰。

sentences.english: But a small amount of anti-freeze was add to it and that seems to solve the problem.
sentences.chinese: 但是少量的反結冰劑被加入，可能會解決這個問題。

sentences.english: I slipped on the icy road and broke my right leg.
sentences.chinese: 我在結冰的路上滑了一跤，跌斷了右腿。

sentences.english: When water freezes, its density decreases.
sentences.chinese: 當水結冰時，它密度會減少。

sentences.english: It's very dangerous to walk on an ice-covered lake in spring.
sentences.chinese: 春天在結冰的湖面上走是很危險的。

sentences.english: Water becomes a solid when it freezes.

definition: to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
Miyun town and county in Beijing
